quotes.quote: The hardest years in life are those between ten and seventy.
Life is like an onion; you peel off one layer at a time and sometimes you weep.
If life gives you lemons, make some kind of fruity juice.
Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people they don't like.
If you're gonna be two-faced at least make one of them pretty.
To write a diary every day is like returning to one's own vomit.
I really don't think I need buns of steel. I'd be happy with buns of cinnamon.
Money never made a man happy yet, nor will it. The more a man has, the more he wants. Instead of filling a vacuum, it makes one.
The man who says his wife can't take a joke, forgets that she took him.
Life is like a taxi. The meter just keeps a-ticking whether you are getting somewhere or just standing still.
The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
Another good thing about being poor is that when you are seventy your children will not have you declared legally insane in order to gain control of your estate.
God made woman beautiful and foolish; beautiful, that man might love her; and foolish, that she might love him.
Don't waste a minute not being happy. If one window closes, run to the next window. Or break down a door.
In every circle of friends there's always that one person everyone secretly hates. Don't have one? Then it's probably you.
A word to the wise ain't necessary. It's the stupid ones who need the advice.
As long as you know men are like children, you know everything!
Before you marry a person, you should first make them use a computer with slow Internet to see who they really are.
I like women, I don't understand them, but I like them.
You are the CEO of your life. Some people need to be hired and some need to be fired.
Keep seeing the glass half-full and it will dawn upon you that it's probably your turn to buy.
If you can't beat them, arrange to have them beaten.
Never follow someone else's path; unless you're in the woods and you're lost and you see a path, then by all means, you should follow that.
Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Too much money ain't enough money.
You don't have to be smart to laugh at farts, but you have to be stupid not to.
The secret to a happy marriage? Do whatever your wife tells you. â€˜Yes, dear.' And breathe.
The crime of loving is forgetting.
I ask people why they have deer heads on their walls. They always say because it's such a beautiful animal. There you go. I think my mother is attractive, but I have photographs of her.
Money doesn't make you happy. I now have $50 million but I was just as happy when I had $48 million.
Not only is life a bitch, it has puppies.
The trouble with children is that they're not returnable.
I wish I could trade my heart for another liver, so I could drink more and care less.
It's not enough to succeed. Others must fail.
You must never underestimate the power of the eyebrow.
Husbands are like fires - they go out when unattended.
The most beautiful makeup for a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy.
Men should be like Kleenex, soft, strong and disposable.
A bore is a man who, when you ask him how he is, tells you.
If you marry a man who cheats on his wife, you'll be married to a man who cheats on his wife.
When a man steals your wife there is no better revenge than to let him keep her.
Did you visit the Parthenon during your trip to Greece?” Shaquille O’Neal: “I can’t really remember the names of the clubs we went to.
I’ve never really wanted to go to Japan. Simply because I don’t like eating fish. And I know that’s very popular out there in Africa.
Crack is cheap. I make too much money to ever smoke crack. Let’s get that straight. OK? We don’t do crack. We don’t do that. Crack is whack.
I still love her. But she’s retarded, too.
I thought Europe was a country.

According to most studies, people’s number one fear is public speaking. Number two is death. Death is number two. Does that seem right? That means to the average person, if you have to go to a funeral, you’re better off in the casket than doing the eulogy.
I asked my brother-in-law, the father of four boys, ‘If you had it to do all over again, would you still have kids?’ ‘Yes,’ he said. ‘Just not these four.
I just realized that ‘Let me check my calendar’ is the adult version of ‘Let me ask my mom.
I want my children to have all the things I couldn’t afford. Then I want to move in with them.
Whoever established the high road and how high it should be should be fired.
Sometimes I am amazed that my wife and I created two human beings from scratch yet struggle to assemble the most basic of IKEA cabinets.
Instant gratification takes too long.
When your children are teenagers, it’s important to have a dog so that someone in the house is happy to see you.
When your mother asks, ‘Do you want a piece of advice?’ it is a mere formality. It doesn’t matter if you answer yes or no. You’re going to get it anyway.
WebMD is updating its server because of a virus. Well, they think it was a virus, but it could also be malaria, kidney failure, a heart murmur, gallstones, or possibly appendicitis.
If you are not yelling at your kids, you are not spending enough time with them.

quotes.quote: User: the word computer professionals use when they mean ‘idiot.
Sometimes you lie in bed at night and you don’t have a single thing to worry about. That always worries me!
As soon as the hospital made me put on one of those little gowns, I knew the end was in sight.
My father always said, ‘Never trust anyone whose TV is bigger than their bookshelf.
The lion and the calf shall lie down together, but the calf won’t get much sleep.
“I make Jessica Simpson look like a rock scientist.
My definition of an intellectual is someone who can listen to the William Tell Overture without thinking of the Lone Ranger.
I won’t go into a big spiel about reincarnation, but the first time I was in the Gucci store in Chicago was the closest I’ve ever felt to home.
I don’t believe in reincarnation, and I didn’t believe in it when I was a hamster.
It’s really hard to maintain a one-on-one relationship if the other person is not going to allow me to be with other people.
Bigamy is having one husband or wife too many. Monogamy is the same.
Not sure which is harder on a relationship: sharing a dresser for three years or sharing an iPhone charger for one day.
Before you criticize someone, you should walk a mile in their shoes. That way when you criticize them, you are a mile away from them and you have their shoes.
You know there is a problem with the education system when you realize that out of the three Rs, only one begins with an R.
